register.name: CUST_WR_RD_LOCK0
register.description: Fuses used to define read/write access permisions to shadows registers of Customer configured OTP words. This is a redundant OTP word hence only 16 bits defined.

bit_field.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_WR
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to DCFG_CC_SOCU and DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP shadow registers. (Fuse 256)

bit_field.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS_WR
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS shadow registers. (Fuse 257)

bit_field.name: OTFAD_CFG_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to OTFAD_CFG shadow register. (Fuse 258)

bit_field.name: RESERVED
bit_field.description: Fuse 259.

bit_field.name: KEY_SCRAMBLE_SEED_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to KEY_SCRAMBLE_SEED shadow register. (Fuse 260)

bit_field.name: KEY_SCRAMBLE_SEED_RD_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to KEY_SCRAMBLE_SEED shadow register. (Fuse 261)

bit_field.name: OTFAD_KEK_SEED_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to OTFAD_KEK_SEED shadow registers. (Fuse 262)

bit_field.name: RESERVED
bit_field.description: Fuse 263

bit_field.name: OTP_MASTER_KEY_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to OTP_MASTER_KEY shadow registers. (Fuse 264)

bit_field.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG5_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to BOOT_CFG[5] shadow registers. (Fuse 265)

bit_field.name: CRC0_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC0 shadow register. (Fuse 268)

bit_field.name: CRC0_RD_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC0 shadow register. (Fuse 269)

bit_field.name: CRC1_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC1 shadow register. (Fuse 270)

bit_field.name: CRC1_RD_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC1 shadow register. (Fuse 271)

register.name: CUST_WR_RD_LOCK1
register.description: Fuses used to define read/write access permisions to shadows registers of customer configured OTP words. This is a redundant OTP word hence only 16 bits defined.

bit_field.name: CRC2_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC2 shadow register. (Fuse 288)

bit_field.name: CRC2_RD_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC2 shadow register. (Fuse 289)

bit_field.name: CRC3_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC3 shadow register. (Fuse 290)

bit_field.name: CRC3_RD_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC3 shadow register. (Fuse 291)

bit_field.name: CRC4_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC4 shadow register. (Fuse 292)

bit_field.name: CRC4_RD_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC4 shadow register. (Fuse 293)

bit_field.name: CRC5_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC5 shadow register. (Fuse 294)

bit_field.name: CRC5_RD_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC5 shadow register. (Fuse 295)

bit_field.name: CRC6_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC6 shadow register. (Fuse 296)

bit_field.name: CRC6_RD_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC6 shadow register. (Fuse 297)

bit_field.name: CRC7_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC7 shadow register. (Fuse 298)

bit_field.name: CRC7_RD_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC7 shadow register. (Fuse 299)

bit_field.name: BOOT_CFG0_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB write access to BOOT_CFG0 and RKTH shadow register. (Fuse 300)

bit_field.name: BOOT_CFG1_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to BOOT_CFG1 shadow register. (Fuse 301)

bit_field.name: BOOT_CFG2_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to BOOT_CFG2 shadow register. (Fuse 302)

bit_field.name: BOOT_CFG3_WR_LOCK
bit_field.description: When set locks APB read access to BOOT_CFG3 shadow register. (Fuse 303)

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU
register.description: Debug Configuration word. Use DCFG_CC_SOCU_WR to write lock this OTP word.

bit_field.name: CRC8
bit_field.description: CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes of this register. Polynomial=0x07, initial value= 0x00, XorOut=0x55.

bit_field.name: DFLT_NIDEN
bit_field.description: Fixed state of Non-secure non-invasive debug enable, when PINNED_NIDEN is set.

bit_field.name: DFLT_DBGEN
bit_field.description: Fixed state of Non-secure invasive debug enable, when PINNED_DBGEN is set.

bit_field.name: DFLT_SPNIDEN
bit_field.description: Fixed state of secure non-invasive debug enable, when PINNED_SPNIDEN is set.

bit_field.name: DFLT_SPIDEN
bit_field.description: Fixed state of secure invasive debug enable, when PINNED_SPIDEN is set.

bit_field.name: DFLT_TAPEN
bit_field.description: Fixed state of Test Access Port enable, when PINNED_TAPEN is set.

bit_field.name: DFLT_DSPEN
bit_field.description: Fixed state of DSP invasive debug enable, when PINNED_DSPEN is set.

bit_field.name: DFLT_ISPCMDEN
bit_field.description: Fixed state of ISP boot flow commands enable, when PINNED_ISPCMDEN is set.

bit_field.name: DFLT_PMCMDEN
bit_field.description: Fixed state of permanent modification commands (set Fault analysis mode) enable, when PINNED_NIDEN is set.

bit_field.name: PINNED_NIDEN
bit_field.description: Fix the state of Non-secure non-invasive debug enable.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field_value.name: FIXED
bit_field_value.description: State of the field is fixed.

bit_field.name: PINNED_DBGEN
bit_field.description: Fix the state of Non-secure invasive debug enable.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field_value.name: FIXED
bit_field_value.description: State of the field is fixed.

bit_field.name: PINNED_SPNIDEN
bit_field.description: Fix the state of secure non-invasive debug enable.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field_value.name: FIXED
bit_field_value.description: State of the field is fixed.

bit_field.name: PINNED_SPIDEN
bit_field.description: Fix the state of secure invasive debug enable.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field_value.name: FIXED
bit_field_value.description: State of the field is fixed.

bit_field.name: PINNED_TAPEN
bit_field.description: Fix the state of Test Access Port enable.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field_value.name: FIXED
bit_field_value.description: State of the field is fixed.

bit_field.name: PINNED_DSPEN
bit_field.description: Fix the state of DSP invasive debug enable.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_ISPCMDEN
bit_field.description: Fix the state of ISP boot flow commands enable.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_PMCMDEN
bit_field.description: Fix the state of permanent modification commands (set Fault analysis mode) enable.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: FORCE_UUID_MATCH
bit_field.description: When set, debug authentication protocol only accepts "Debug Credential" certificates (DC) with matching UUID.

register.name: BOOT_CFG[0]
register.description: Boot configuration word0. Shadow register is present for this word thus SW could access the register directly to read contents.

bit_field.name: PRIMARY_BOOT_SRC
bit_field.description: Primary boot Source. (a.k.a. Master boot source)

bit_field_value.name: ISP_PIN_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: ISP pins will determine boot source.

bit_field_value.name: QSPI_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from Octal/Quad SPI flash device using FlexSpi channel A interface pins.

bit_field_value.name: SDHC0_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from eMMC device or SD card connected to SDHC0 port.

bit_field_value.name: SDHC1_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from eMMC device or SD card connected to SDHC1 port.

bit_field_value.name: SPI_SLV_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot using SPI slave interface using master boot mode.

bit_field_value.name: UART_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot using UART interface using master boot mode.

bit_field_value.name: SPI_FC_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from 1-bit SPI flash device from FlexCom interface pins selected by REDUNDANT_SPI_PORT field. Only load-to-RAM images are supported in this mode.

bit_field_value.name: USB_DFU_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from USB interface using DFU boot mode.

bit_field_value.name: ISP_MODE
bit_field_value.description: Always enter ISP mode. DEFAULT_ISP_MODE field will determine the ISP interface.

bit_field_value.name: QSPI_REC_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from Octal/Quad SPI flash device using FlexSPI channel A interface pins. If image is not found check recovery boot using SPI-flash device through FlexComm.

bit_field_value.name: SDHC0_REC_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from SDHC0 port device. If image is not found check recovery boot using SPI-flash device through FlexComm.

bit_field_value.name: SDHC1_REC_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from SDHC1 port device. If image is not found check recovery boot using SPI-flash device through FlexComm.

bit_field.name: DEFAULT_ISP_MODE
bit_field.description: When a valid image is not available to master boot, ROM switches to ISP mode for programming primary boot devices. This field determines the default ISP mode.

bit_field_value.name: AUTO_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Auto detect ISP mode. ROM monitors USB, UART, SPI and I2C interfaces for any activity.

bit_field_value.name: USB_HID_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Support ISP command interface using USB HID class only.

bit_field_value.name: UART_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Support ISP command interface on UART port only.

bit_field_value.name: SPI_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Support ISP command interface on SPI port only.

bit_field_value.name: I2C_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Support ISP command interface on I2C port only.

bit_field_value.name: DISABLE_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Disable ISP fall through when proper image is not found on primary boot device.

bit_field.name: BOOT_CLK_SPEED
bit_field.description: Defines clock speeds during boot.

bit_field_value.name: NORMAL_CLK
bit_field_value.description: Normal boot. All clocks are set to 48MHz using IRC48M, except USB block. USB block will use external XTAL clock.

bit_field_value.name: HISPEED_CLK
bit_field_value.description: High-speed boot. o Core clock is set to 198MHz using main_pll with IRC48M as input o UART, I2C : 48MHz (IRC48M) o SPI, SDHC: 198MHz (main_pll) o USB: external XTAL o OSPI: Set to differnet speed using aux0_pll. Speed of OSPI interface is obtained from Boot Configuration Block present on OSPI-flash device. · SDR: 30/50/60/72/80/90/100 MHz · DDR: 30/50/60/72/80 MHz

bit_field.name: RSA4K_EN
bit_field.description: Use 4096 bit RSA keys only for certificate validations. By default the ROM assume 2048-bit keys.

bit_field_value.name: RSA2K
bit_field_value.description: Use RSA2K or higher key length operations to validate certificates, image and debug credentials.

bit_field_value.name: RSA4K
bit_field_value.description: Use RSA4K operations to validate certificates, image and debug credentials.

bit_field_value.name: TZM_NORMAL
bit_field_value.description: TrustZone-M mode is determined by the image header.

bit_field_value.name: TZM_DISABLE
bit_field_value.description: Disable TrustZone-M features. ROM will always boot to a non-secure code and all TZ-M features are disabled.

bit_field_value.name: TZM_ENABLE
bit_field_value.description: TrustZone-M features are enabled. ROM will always boot to secure code.

bit_field_value.name: TZM_PRESET
bit_field_value.description: TrustZone-M features are enabled and setting are loaded from image header and locked before branching to user code.

bit_field.name: PSA_BSTATE_SKIP
bit_field.description: If set, ROM skips computation of boot state defined by PSA specification. As part of boot state computation ROM includes OTP words - Shadow register values of 95 to 104 - Fuse values of words 128 to 147.

bit_field.name: PSA_BSTATE_INC_KEYS
bit_field.description: If set, boot state computation includes OTP shadow register values of words 106 to 127.

bit_field.name: REDUNDANT_SPI_PORT
bit_field.description: FlexComm port to use for redundant SPI flash boot.

bit_field_value.name: FC0
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom0 pins P0_0 (SCK), P0_1 (MISO), P0_2 (MOSI), P0_3 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC1
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom1 pins P0_7 (SCK), P0_8 (MISO), P0_9 (MOSI), P0_10 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC2
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom2 pins P0_14 (SCK), P0_15 (MISO), P0_16 (MOSI), P0_17 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC3
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom3 pins P0_21 (SCK), P0_22 (MISO), P0_23 (MOSI), P0_24 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC4
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom4 pins P0_28 (SCK), P0_29 (MISO), P0_30 (MOSI), P0_31 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC5
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom5 pins P1_3 (SCK), P1_4 (MISO), P1_5 (MOSI), P1_6 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC6
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom6 pins P3_25 (SCK), P3_26 (MISO), P3_27 (MOSI), P3_28 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC7
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom7 pins P4_0 (SCK), P4_1 (MISO), P4_2 (MOSI), P4_3 (SEL)

bit_field.name: SECURE_BOOT_EN
bit_field.description: Force secure image only.

bit_field_value.name: DISABLED
bit_field_value.description: Allow non-secure images with and without CRC. Used during development.

bit_field_value.name: ENABLED
bit_field_value.description: Secure boot is enabled. The images have to be singned and optionally AES-CTR encrypted using pre-shared key. ROM does signature checking first and then does decryption of authenticated image.

bit_field_value.name: ENABLED
bit_field_value.description: Secure boot is enabled.

bit_field_value.name: ENABLED
bit_field_value.description: Secure boot is enabled.

bit_field.name: DICE_INC_OTP
bit_field.description: Include non-field updatable OTP Fields in DICE computation. OTP values in shadow registers are used in computation for words 95, 96, 98, 99, 104, 120 - 127.

bit_field.name: DICE_SKIP
bit_field.description: If set, ROM skips computation of Composite Device Identifier (CDI) defined in DICE specification. But ROM will continue to hide UDS source in OTP and PUF (index 15) before passing control to user code.

bit_field.name: BOOT_FAIL_PIN
bit_field.description: GPIO port and pin number to use for indicating boot failure. Boot ROM will drive this pin high before locking the chip on error conditions. Applications can use this pin to power cycle the system. [2:0] - Defines GPIO port [7:3] - Defines GPIO pin

register.name: BOOT_CFG[1]
register.description: Boot configuration word specifying Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices settings.

bit_field.name: QSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN
bit_field.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash auto probe feature enable.

bit_field.name: QSPI_PROBE_TYPE
bit_field.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash probe type.

bit_field_value.name: QSPI_NOR
bit_field_value.description: QuadSPI NOR

bit_field_value.name: MICRON_OCTAL
bit_field_value.description: Micron Octal FLASH

bit_field_value.name: MACRONIX_OCTAL
bit_field_value.description: Macronix Octal FLASH

bit_field_value.name: ADESTO_OCTAL
bit_field_value.description: Adesto Octal FLASH

bit_field.name: QSPI_FLASH_TYPE
bit_field.description: Define typical Serial NOR Flash types

bit_field_value.name: QSPI_ADDR_3B
bit_field_value.description: Device supports 3B read by default

bit_field_value.name: HYPER_1V8
bit_field_value.description: HyperFlash 1V8

bit_field_value.name: HYPER_3V3
bit_field_value.description: HyperFlash 3V3

bit_field_value.name: OSPI_DDR_MXIC
bit_field_value.description: MXIC Octal DDR

bit_field_value.name: OSPI_DDR_MICRON
bit_field_value.description: Micron Octal DDR

bit_field.name: QSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES
bit_field.description: Quad/Octal-SPI dummy cycles for read command.

bit_field.name: QSPI_FREQUENCY
bit_field.description: Q/O-SPI flash interface frequency.

bit_field.name: QSPI_RESET_PIN_ENABLE
bit_field.description: Use QSPI_RESET_PIN to reset the flash device.

bit_field_value.name: NO_RESET
bit_field_value.description: O/QSPI device reset pin is not connected or available.

bit_field_value.name: EN_RESET
bit_field_value.description: O/QSPI device reset pin is connected to a GPIO (QSPI_RESET_PIN).

bit_field.name: QSPI_RESET_PIN
bit_field.description: GPIO port and pin number to use for O/QSPI reset function.

bit_field_value.name: GPIO_PORT
bit_field_value.description: Defines GPIO port.

bit_field_value.name: GPIO_PIN_NUM
bit_field_value.description: Defines GPIO pin number.

bit_field.name: QSPI_HOLD TIME
bit_field.description: Wait time before access to Serial Flash.

bit_field_value.name: WAIT_500_US
bit_field_value.description: Wait for 500 micro seconds.

bit_field_value.name: WAIT_1_MS
bit_field_value.description: Wait for 1 milli seconds.

bit_field_value.name: WAIT_3_MS
bit_field_value.description: Wait for 3 milli seconds.

bit_field_value.name: WAIT_10_MS
bit_field_value.description: Wait for 10 milli seconds.

bit_field.name: QSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME
bit_field.description: Delay after POR before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices in addition to delay defined by QSPI_HOLD TIME field.

bit_field_value.name: NO_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: No delay

bit_field_value.name: 100US_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 100 micro-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 500US_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 500 micro-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 1MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 1 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 10MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 10 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 20MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 20 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 40MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 40 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 60MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 60 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 80MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 80 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 100MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 100 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 120MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 120 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 140MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 140 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 160MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 160 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 180MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 180 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 200MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 200 milli-seconds.

bit_field_value.name: 220MS_DELAY
bit_field_value.description: Waits additional 220 milli-seconds.

register.name: BOOT_CFG[2]
register.description: Boot configuration word specifying settings for SD card and eMMC boot interface.

bit_field.name: SDHC_DEVICE_TYPE
bit_field.description: Device type connected to SDHC port.

bit_field_value.name: eMMC_DEV
bit_field_value.description: eMMC device

bit_field_value.name: SD_DEV
bit_field_value.description: SD card device

bit_field.name: SDHC_BUS_WIDTH
bit_field.description: Bus width of the device connected to SDHC.

bit_field_value.name: SD_1B_MMC_4B
bit_field_value.description: For SD cards use 1-bit data bus. For eMMC use 4-bit data bus.

bit_field_value.name: SD_4B_MMC_8B
bit_field_value.description: For SD cards use 4-bit data bus. For eMMC use 8-bit data bus.

bit_field_value.name: MMC_4B_DDR
bit_field_value.description: For eMMC use 4-bit bus in DDR mode.

bit_field_value.name: MMC_8B_DDR
bit_field_value.description: For eMMC use 8-bit bus in DDR mode.

bit_field.name: SDHC_SPEED
bit_field.description: Speed raings of eMMC devices and SD card devices.

bit_field_value.name: NORMAL
bit_field_value.description: Normal speed for eMMC devices. SDR12 speeds for SD.

bit_field_value.name: HIGH
bit_field_value.description: High speed for eMMC devices. SDR25 speeds for SD.

bit_field_value.name: SDR50
bit_field_value.description: SDR50 speeds for SD card.

bit_field.name: SDHC_PWR_CYCLE_EN
bit_field.description: Enable SDHC power cycle via USDHC_RST pad.

bit_field.name: SDHC0_PWR_POL
bit_field.description: Polarity of power enable signal for SDHC0 port.

bit_field_value.name: ACTIVE_HIGH
bit_field_value.description: Active high signal.

bit_field_value.name: ACTIVE_LOW
bit_field_value.description: Active low signal.

bit_field.name: SDHC1_PWR_POL
bit_field.description: Polarity of power enable signal for SDHC1 port.

bit_field_value.name: ACTIVE_HIGH
bit_field_value.description: Active high signal.

bit_field_value.name: ACTIVE_LOW
bit_field_value.description: Active low signal.

bit_field.name: SDHC_PWR_CYCLE_WAIT
bit_field.description: Wait time after powering down the SDHC devices.

bit_field_value.name: WAIT_20_MS
bit_field_value.description: Wait 20 milli seconds.

bit_field_value.name: WAIT_10_MS
bit_field_value.description: Wait 10 milli seconds.

bit_field_value.name: WAIT_05_MS
bit_field_value.description: Wait 5 milli seconds.

bit_field_value.name: WAIT_2_5_MS
bit_field_value.description: Wait 2.5 milli seconds.

bit_field.name: SDHC_PWR_STABLE_WAIT
bit_field.description: Wait time for power to stabilize after enabling power to SDHC devices.

bit_field_value.name: WAIT_5_MS
bit_field_value.description: Wait 5 milli seconds.

bit_field_value.name: WAIT_2_5_MS
bit_field_value.description: Wait 2.5 milli seconds.

bit_field.name: SDHC0_CARD_VOLTAGE
bit_field.description: SD Voltage selection for SDHC0 port.

bit_field_value.name: 3V3
bit_field_value.description: Uses 3v3 rail.

bit_field_value.name: 1V8
bit_field_value.description: Uses 1v8 rail.

bit_field.name: SDHC1_CARD_VOLTAGE
bit_field.description: SD Voltage selection for SDHC1 port.

bit_field_value.name: 3V3
bit_field_value.description: Uses 3v3 rail.

bit_field_value.name: 1V8
bit_field_value.description: Uses 1v8 rail.

bit_field.name: MMC_RESET_PRE_IDLE_STATE
bit_field.description: Reset the MMC to Pre-Idle state before starting boot mode

bit_field.name: SDHC_FASTBOOT_MODE
bit_field.description: Specifies if the boot mode is enabled in Extended CSD register of the eMMC device.

bit_field_value.name: NORMAL_MODE
bit_field_value.description: eMMC operates in transfer mode after power-up.

bit_field_value.name: BOOT_MODE
bit_field_value.description: eMMC operates in boot mode after power-up.

bit_field.name: SDHC_FASTBOOT_ACK_EN
bit_field.description: Specifies if the eMMC device sends boot acknowledge pattern during boot operation.

bit_field.name: SDHC_PAD_CTL_FREEZE
bit_field.description: When using SDHC interface in high speed modes, the auto pad compensation control logic could cause interference due to modifications in IO drive strength. Hence it is recommemded to freeze the compensated value and enable auto compensatation periodically in application code by puting the pad back to normal mode. When this field is set ROM freezes the auto compenstation circuit during boot.

bit_field.name: SDHC_PAD_CTL_FAST_FREEZE
bit_field.description: Same as SDHC_PAD_CTL_FREEZE, but in this mode the time taken for switching the compensation from Fast Freeze mode to Normal mode is considerably smaller than the delay incurred in switching from Freeze mode to Normal mode.

bit_field.name: QSPI_PAD_CTL_FREEZE
bit_field.description: When using QSPI interface in high speed modes, the auto pad compensation control logic could cause interference due to modifications in IO drive strength. Hence it is recommemded to freeze the compensated value and enable auto compensatation periodically in application code by puting the pad back to normal mode. When this field is set ROM freezes the auto compenstation circuit during boot.

bit_field.name: QSPI_PAD_CTL_FAST_FREEZE
bit_field.description: Same as QSPI_PAD_CTL_FREEZE, but in this mode the time taken for switching the compensation from Fast Freeze mode to Normal mode is considerably smaller than the delay incurred in switching from Freeze mode to Normal mode.

bit_field.name: QSPI_IMAGE_SIZE
bit_field.description: Any offset in memory mapped QSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. QSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of second image. QSPI_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped.

register.name: BOOT_CFG[3]
register.description: Boot configuration word specifying delay lines seetings for SDHC and QSPI interfaces.

bit_field.name: QSPI_DELAY_CELL_NUM
bit_field.description: Delay cell numbers for Flash read sampling via DQS (either internal loopback or external DQS)

bit_field_value.name: DISABLED
bit_field_value.description: Default： DLL delay tuning start 10, DLL delay tuning step 2 ( this config can cover most of user cases.)

bit_field_value.name: ENABLED
bit_field_value.description: Override by SDHC_DLL_SETTING

bit_field.name: SDHC_DLL_TUNING_START
bit_field.description: DLL delay tuning start.

bit_field.name: SDHC_DLL_TUNING_STEP
bit_field.description: DLL delay tuning step.

bit_field.name: USB_PLL_DIV_SEL
bit_field.description: USB PLL divider value. Used for configuring USB PLL during USB ISP and DFU boot modes. The value corresponds to the PLL_DIV_SEL field of the USBPHY_PLL_SIC register.

bit_field.name: QSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET
bit_field.description: Any offset in memory mapped QSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. QSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of second image. QSPI_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped. If this field is left blank boot ROM assumes that application intends to not use dual image boot feature. The physical flash offset is computed as below: physical offset = QSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET * 256KByte;

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS
register.description: With TZ-M, the part can be sold by level 1 customers (secure code developer) to level-2 customers who develops non-secure code only. - In this scenario, or easy of development, Level-I customer releases the part to always allow non-secure debug. - To allow level-2 customers to further seal the part DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS is used. - ROM will use this word to further restrict the debug access. - Layout of this word is same as DCFG_CC_SOCU. 1. Pinned disabled state is assumed the highest level of restriction. (PINNED_xxxEN = 1, DFLT_xxxEN = 0) 2. Un-pinned PINNED_xxxEN = 0, DFLT_xxxEN = 0 or 1) 3. Pinned enabled state is the lowest level. PINNED_xxxEN = 1, DFLT_xxxEN =1

bit_field.name: REVOKE_ROOTKEY
bit_field.description: Revoke upto 4 root keys. When a bit is set corresponding root key is revoked.

bit_field.name: FA_MODE_EN
bit_field.description: Enable Fault Analysis mode. - When set ROM checks and erases customer sensitive assets (AES keys or key codes) stored in IFR/OTP. - Issues zeroized command to PUF (disables key decoding until POR) - Blocks all HW routed OTP keys and set lock bits on those registers - Enables all debug ports and waits in loop for tester.

bit_field.name: ENABLE_CRC_CHECK
bit_field.description: Enable CRC checking of OTP words.

register.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG[5]
register.description: Boot configuration word5. - This word is set in redundant mode. Thus individual bits can be programmed seperately at different lifecycle stages of the device.

bit_field.name: REVOKE_ROOTKEY
bit_field.description: Revoke upto 4 root keys. When a bit is set corresponding root key is revoked.

bit_field.name: FA_MODE_EN
bit_field.description: Enable Fault Analysis mode. - When set ROM checks and erases customer sensitive assets (AES keys or key codes) stored in IFR/OTP. - Issues zeroized command to PUF (disables key decoding until POR) - Blocks all HW routed OTP keys and set lock bits on those registers - Enables all debug ports and waits in loop for tester.

bit_field.name: ENABLE_CRC_CHECK
bit_field.description: Enable CRC checking of OTP words.

bit_field.name: USE_PUF
bit_field.description: Use PUF to store AES keys and UDS.

bit_field_value.name: KEY_IN_OTP
bit_field_value.description: AES keys and UDS are read from OTP.

bit_field_value.name: KEY_IN_PUF
bit_field_value.description: AES keys and UDS are read from PUF.

bit_field.name: PUF_BLOCK_ENROLL
bit_field.description: Block further enrollement of PUF block. When this bit is set ROM blocks generation of new activation codes.

bit_field_value.name: ENROLL_EN
bit_field_value.description: Enable generation of new activation code.

bit_field_value.name: ENROLL_DIS
bit_field_value.description: Disable generation of new activation code.

bit_field.name: PUF_BLOCK_SET_KEY
bit_field.description: Block further enrollement of PUF block. When this bit is set ROM blocks generation of new key codes.

bit_field_value.name: KEY_GEN_EN
bit_field_value.description: Enable generation of new key codes.

bit_field_value.name: KEY_GEN_DIS
bit_field_value.description: Disable generation of new key codes.

bit_field.name: REVOKE_IMG_KEY
bit_field.description: To implement anti-rollback feature, the image key certificate should be revoked using this field. The in-field FW update process should blow the least unblown bit. During image key certificate validation this field is compare with the certificate content (upper 2 bytes of serial number field in X.509 certificate).

register.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG[7]
register.description: Boot configuration word7. - This word is set in redundant mode. Thus individual bits can be programmed seperately at different lifecycle stages of the device.

bit_field.name: DAP_VENDOR_USAGE
bit_field.description: Lower 16-bits of Vendor Usage field in Debug Credentials defined in NXP's Debug Authentication Protocol specifications Version 1.0.

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP
register.description: Anti-pole (inverse) value of Debug Configuration word(DCFG_CC_SOCU). Use DCFG_CC_SOCU_WR to write lock this OTP word.

register.name: OTFAD_CFG
register.description: Configuration word to control OTFAD key blob loading during boot process.

bit_field.name: RSRVD
bit_field.description: Reserved. Should be set to zero.

register.name: KEY_SCRAMBLE_SEED
register.description: Key scramble data used as input to scramble master key stored in OTP.

bit_field.name: SCRAMBLE_INPUT
bit_field.description: 32-bit random value programmed by user which will be used as one of the two inputs to scramble OTP_MASTER_KEK key.

register.name: OTFAD_KEK_SEED
register.description: When OTP key store is used (USE_PUF = 0), this 128-bit user programmed value is used to derive OTFAD_KEK. OTFAD_KEK[127:0] = AES_ENCRYPT (OTP_MASTER_KEK, OTFAD_KEK_SEED[127:0]);

register.name: OTP_MASTER_KEY
register.description: Master Key used to derive different usage keys (HMAC_KEY, ENC_IMAGE_KEY, SB2_KEK, OTFAD_KEK). - ENC_BOOT_HMAC_KEY[127:0] = AES_ENCRYPT (OTP_MASTER_KEK, 0x00000000000000000000000000000000); - ENC_BOOT_AES_KEY[256:0] = AES_ENCRYPT (OTP_MASTER_KEK, 0x00000000000000000000000000000001) || AES_ENCRYPT (OTP_MASTER_KEK, 0x00000000000000000000000000000002); - SB_KEK[256:0] = AES_ENCRYPT (OTP_MASTER_KEK, 0x00000000000000000000000000000003) || AES_ENCRYPT (OTP_MASTER_KEK, 0x00000000000000000000000000000004); OR if SBKEK_SEED != 0 then SB_KEK[255:0] = AES_ENCRYPT (OTP_MASTER_KEK, SBKEK_SEED[255:0]); - OTFAD_KEK[127:0] = AES_ENCRYPT (OTP_MASTER_KEK, OTFAD_KEK_SEED[127:0]);

register.name: RKTH
register.description: SHA256 hash digest of hash of four Root Of Trust Keys (modulus || exponent). For i in 0..3: Let M[i] = BE(Modulus i) Let E[i] = BE(Exponent i) Let RKH[i] = SHA256( M[i] || E[i] ) Let RKTH = SHA256( RKH[0] || RKH[1] || RKH[2] || RKH[3] ) Note: Documentation update needed when using blhost due to endianness issue.
